t: The Blessing and Suffering of the Godly
To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David.
Blessed*pn is*i he who considers the poor; The*ld Lord*s will deliver him in time of trouble.
The*ld Lord*s will preserve him and keep him alive, And*ild he will be blessed on the earth; You*ld will not deliver him to the will of his enemies.
The*ld Lord*s will strengthen him on his bed of illness; You*ld will sustain him on his sickbed.
I*ln said, “Lord,*s be merciful to me; Heal*ld my soul, for I have sinned against You.”
My*ld enemies speak evil of me: “When*ld will he die, and his name perish?”
And*ld if he comes to see me,*i he speaks lies; His*ld heart gathers iniquity to itself; When*ild he goes out, he tells it.*i
All*ln who hate me whisper together against me; Against*ld me they devise my hurt.
“An*ld evil disease,” they*i say,*i “clings to him. And*ld now*i that he lies down, he will rise up no more.”
Even*ld my own familiar friend in whom I trusted, Who*ld ate my bread, Has*ld lifted up his*i heel against me.
But*ln You, O Lord,*s be merciful to me, and raise me up, That*ld I may repay them.
By*ld this I know that You are well pleased with me, Because*ld my enemy does not triumph over me.
As*ld for me, You uphold me in my integrity, And*ld set me before Your face forever.
Blessed*ln be*i the Lord*s God of Israel From*ld everlasting to everlasting! Amen*ld and Amen.
